meanings.definition: The act of retracting or withdrawing something.
meanings.sent1: The retraction of the claws helped the cat climb down safely.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper issued a retraction after publishing incorrect information.
meanings.sent3: The retraction of the offer to share the last cookie caused a playful argument.
meanings.sent4: The retraction of the curtains revealed a stunning view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The retraction of the bridge made the river seem wider and more powerful.

meanings.definition: A statement or article that is withdrawn or taken back.
meanings.sent1: The retraction of the apology surprised everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The retraction of the controversial article sparked a debate among readers.
meanings.sent3: The retraction of the joke made the comedian's routine even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The retraction of the rumor spread faster than the original gossip.
meanings.sent5: The retraction of the promise left a sense of disappointment in the air.

meanings.definition: The process of pulling something back or inwards.
meanings.sent1: The retraction of the telescope revealed a clear view of the stars.
meanings.sent2: The retraction of the fishing line brought in a big catch.
meanings.sent3: The retraction of the slingshot caused the pebble to fall harmlessly.
meanings.sent4: The retraction of the piston created a vacuum in the engine.
meanings.sent5: The retraction of the turtle's head into its shell fascinated the children.
